description:
The excavation of a basement area and erection of a basement
plus 6 storey building for a use within classes A1/A2/A3/B1
at basement and ground floors, with B1 use on first to fifth
floors,
as shown on drawing numbers: 1803/PL/DEM, /01, /03, /09,
/10, /12, 1803/4/201 Rev. A, 1803/4/200, 1803/1/200, 1803/4/
100 Rev. T, 1803/b/100 Rev. T, 1803/1/100 Rev. A, 1803/1/101
Rev. T, 1803/1/102 Rev. T, 1803/1/103 Rev. T, 1803/1/105
Rev. T, 1803/1/106 Rev. T, 1803/1/110 Rev. T, 1803/1/111
Rev. T, 1803/1/120 Rev. T, 1803/8/101, 1803/8/102, 1803/8/
103, Computer generated photo; acoustic report; air handling
technical information; pre construction method statement.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Details of the provision for access for disabled persons in
    compliance with the provisions of Section 4 of the
    Chronically & Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 and the
    1985 Building  Regulations (as amended by the Building
    (Disabled People) Regulations 1987) shall not be otherwise
    than as shall have been approved by the Council before any
    work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - Details of  the elevations, and details and samples of
    facing materials to be used on the building, shall not be
    otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved
    by the Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 3 - Details of external ground floor shutters proposed to secure
    the main entrance, shall not be otherwise than as shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council before work on site
    commences.

Condition : 4 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 5 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to adjoining
    equipment at any adjoining premises to be at least 10dB(A)
    below the LA90 expressed in dB(A). For the purposes of this
    development, the background noise levels shall be taken as
    47dB(A) LA90 day time and 45 dB(A) LA90 night time.
    premises shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing
    background measurement (LA90 ), expressed in dB(A) when all
    plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is anticipated
    that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a
    distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine,
    hiss,screech,hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses
    (bangs,clicks,clatters,thups) special attention should be
    given to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/

Condition : 6 - The A3 use hereby permitted shall not commence until full
    details of the scheme for the ventilation of and the
    extraction of fumes from the premises to an adequate outlet
    level, including details of sound attenuation for any
    necessary plant have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council and the development shall not be carried out
    otherwise than in accordance with any approval given.

Condition : 7 - The A3 use hereby permitted shall not be carried out outside
    the following times 0900 hours to 2300 hours.

Condition : 8 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to
    be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining
    highway.

Condition : 9 - Prior to the commencement of the use of the ground floor and
    basement use/s, details shall be submitted to, approved by
    the Council for the provision of a secure area for the
    storage of three cycles which shall be permanently retained.

Condition : 10 - In order to ensure compliance with the terms of the Act and
    Regulations in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE3 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13, EN18, EN31 and EN38 of
    the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13, EN18, EN31 and EN38 of
    the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of
    policies RE2 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of
    policies RE2 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of
    policies RE2 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of
    policies RE2 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of
    policies RE2 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To ensure the availability of facilities for cyclists to
    comply with London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000 policy TR22.

Condition : 19 - This permission is granted without prejudice to the
    necessity of obtaining Conservation Area Consent for the
    demolition of the existing structures on the site.
    Application forms may be obtained from the Council's One
    Stop Reception, Environment Department, Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020-7278 4444).

Condition : 20 - This permission is granted without prejudice to the
    necessity of obtaining consent under the Town and Country
    Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992.
    Application forms may be obtained from the Council's One
    Stop Reception, Environment Department, Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020-7278 4444).

Condition : 21 - Your proposals may be subject to control under the Building
    Act 1984, the Building Regulations and the London Building
    Acts: 1930-82, and you are advised to consult the Council's
    Building Control Service, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street
    WC1H 8EQ  (tel: 020-7974 6941).

Condition : 22 - Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the Council's
    Environment & Consumer Protection Service, Waste Management
    Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road, WC1H
    8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444) regarding arrangements for the
    disposal of refuse.

Condition : 23 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 24 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939.

Condition : 25 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all hotels, restaurants, wine bars
    and public houses to do so as well. Further information can
    be obtained by telephoning the Council's Street environment
    Service (Recycling) on 020 7974 1553.

Condition : 26 - You are advised that tables and chairs must not be placed on
    the highway without licence from the Council under the
    Highways Act 1980.

Condition : 27 - The details required pursuant to additional condition(s) 1,
    2, 3, 6 and 9 should be submitted together with 5 sets of
    drawings and any other supporting information.
